name: Aloft New Delhi Aerocity
description:
Boasting a fitness center and a garden, Aloft New Delhi Aerocity is located in New Delhi, 1.2 mi from New Delhi International Airport. 118thUnited States of AmericaFirst, the rooms. I stayed at a "King Bed, High Floor" room for 4 nights. The king-sized bed was soooo comfortable. I have sleep problems, but I was able to get a good night's rest every night thanks to the comfy mattress and pillows. Maybe it was too comfortable, because I didn't want to get out of bed at times üòù The room was always clean (thank you, Housekeeping team) and the A/C worked like wonders (cool and cozy was the atmosphere). Not a single dust was seen on the washroom area, and the toilet and shower worked well, too. The rooms also had all the basic amenities.

Second, location. I was told by my tour driver that the location of the hotel is good, because it's right on the "entrance" of Delhi (under the assumption that you are coming back from Agra or Jaipur). It's also safe to stay at because all passerby goes through security check upon entering the building. Not only is the hotel close to the airport, but also has free airport pick-up/drop-off service.

Third, room service & food. I had breakfast included in my reservation which, upon request, was brought to my room. This saved me a lot of time as I was able to eat while getting ready to leave for a tour. Room service was also exceptional. They're quick to answer your calls and cater to your needs any time of the day. The meals were not too salty or strongly flavored. I especially loved the fruit platter for its freshness and variety.

Last but not least, staff. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. I initially had an issue with the room, in which I was not given a "6 and above floor" room that I originally booked for. I didn't notice it myself until my second-to-last night, when I went over to the reception desk to request late checkout. The staff and manager were quick to fix the problem by reimbursing me with a discounted late checkout fee. Also, each and every staff are extremely responsive.

KyleUnited States of AmericaOur recent stay at Hotel Barcelona was nothing short of exceptional. Located in the vibrant heart of the city, this gem offers a perfect blend of luxury, comfort, and convenience.

From the moment we stepped into the hotel, we were greeted with a warm welcome and impeccable service. The lobby exudes elegance with its modern decor and inviting atmosphere. The front desk staff was incredibly helpful, providing insightful recommendations for local dining and attractions.

The room was a sanctuary of tranquility, beautifully appointed with contemporary furnishings and an eye for detail. The bed was exceptionally comfortable, ensuring restful nights after exploring the city. The large windows offered stunning views of Barcelona‚Äôs skyline, and the en-suite bathroom was a haven of relaxation with high-end toiletries and a spacious shower.

Dining at the hotel was a delight. The breakfast buffet featured a wide array of fresh, delicious options, from pastries and fruits to hearty hot dishes. The rooftop terrace provided a picturesque setting for an evening drink, with panoramic views of the city‚Äôs landmarks.

The hotel's location is ideal for tourists. It is just a short walk from major attractions such as La Rambla, the Gothic Quarter, and the renowned Passeig de Gr√†cia. Public transportation is easily accessible, making it convenient to explore further afield.

In summary, Hotel Barcelona offers a superb experience for travelers seeking luxury and comfort in a prime location. The combination of exceptional service, elegant accommodations, and prime location makes it a standout choice for anyone visiting this vibrant city. We will certainly return on our next trip to Barcelona!!.

preview_comment: We have traveled to 14 cities this summer (lots of hotels) and LOFT was hands down the best! it is located within walking distance between the train station and Old Town‚Äî10 minutes depending on your walking speed. The rooms are decorated in a cool industrial/steampunk-ish style, large, clean, and comfortable. We loved the complimentary mini-bar which included beer, coolers, water, and soda/pop. You also get a coffee machine with illy coffee, tea, biscuits/cookies <3. There is an insane amount of delish choices for breakfast, it felt like a mini brunch. We also had a wine machine in the hallway (I don't think this is included with all room rates) the first glass was free, yayyyyy!!!!

name: Airways Hotel
description:

AndrewAustraliaThe Airways is my hotel of choice in Port Moresby. It's very convenient for the airport and for working with agencies who are based near the airport. Staff are consistently friendly and try and be helpful.   The property is spectacular with a very spacious vibe - the bookcases, reading and lounge areas lend a real air of relaxation, and the gym in the complex is useful. The rooms (I've had a few) range from nice to spectacular.  Meals are excellent by PNG standards.  Also, a special note about the business centre - I've often gone to them with short notice printing requests and they are very helpful with doing reasonable printing for no extra charge. 
Working in PNG can feel a bit suffocating if your employer does not allow you to travel without security, so the roomy Airways is great in that context.

name: Kumari Boutique Hotel
description: Conveniently set in the center of Kathmandu, Kumari Boutique Hotel provides air-conditioned rooms with free WiFi, free private parking and room service. danielleUnited States of AmericaKumari Boutique Hotel felt like home. A perfect piece of calm and tranquility amidst the busy streets of Kathmandu. The location is ideal, within walking distance of restaurants, cafes, spas, vibrant markets, and cultural heritage sites. Durbar Square, a UNESCO World heritage site, and the Garden of Dreams are within 10-15 mins walking distance. The hotel is charming with beautiful cultural architectural design elements on the outside and modern finishings for comfort on the inside. The wifi is fast. Equipped with an elevator for accessibility. The rooms are clean and there are only 18 rooms so it's nice and quiet. The staff are warm and kind. Always ready to help. I was able to exchange money and even take advantage of their tour desk. The food is amazing! Order the traditional Nepali curry chicken set for lunch or dinner. They also offer complimentary masala tea. As a solo female traveler I felt absolutely safe. 10/10 would definitely recommend.
